column4: hi guys. I'm installing Dapper on a Dell Inspiron 700m and during the package configuration it stops at about 58%. the screen goes blank and two small, white rectangles appear (one in the middle, one on the left) on the screen. it continues to access the drive for a bit and then it stops so I just shut it off. any ideas?
if you are using a cd other than the desktop/live one I would suggest turning off framebuffer to see if that helps.
it might be that the installer still work and display messages, but you wouldn't know. turning off the framebuffer helps most of the time if you get a garbled display.
how do I turn off the framebuffer?
good question. on the older versions of ubuntu you ran "linux debian-installer/framebuffer=false" but on 6.06 I don't know. someone else has an idea?
when you run the install cd you should have some help screens that show you how
